intro: Siphocampylus umbellatus var. ayavacensis, commonly known as the Ayavacensis bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its striking floral display.
